title: How to Evolve Scyther into Scizor & Kleavor

steps.title: Buy a Metal Coat from Delibird Presents in Levincia.
steps.content: Buy a Metal Coat from Delibird Presents in Levincia. Head over to Levinicia, the town with the Electric Gym. Make your way over to the northern portion of this area, where you’ll pass the Delibird Presents store. There, purchase the Metal Coat item for 3,000 Pokédollars. [1] X Research source If you’re feeling lucky, you might be able to buy a Metal Coat from the Porto Marinada Auction House. Still, visiting Delibird Presents is the most reliable and consistent way to get this item.

steps.title: Give the Metal Coat to your Scyther as a held item.
steps.content: Give the Metal Coat to your Scyther as a held item. Go into the “Other Items” section of your inventory, scroll to Metal Coat, and select the “Give to a Pokémon” option. Then, select Scyther from your Pokémon party to hand him the item. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Trade your Scyther with a friend.
steps.content: Trade your Scyther with a friend. Hit up a friend who also owns Pokémon Scarlet or Violet and head into the Poké Portal section of your game. Using the “Link Trade” feature, trade your Scyther (now holding Metal Coat) over to your friend. Wait for Scyther to evolve into Scizor, and then ask your friend to trade it back. [3] X Research source Don’t have a friend who owns the game? Using the “Link Trade” feature, some crafty traders have created private trades with the code set to 02600260 (with extra zeros added to complete the 8-digit number). Only trainers aiming to evolve their Scythers will use this code, so both you and the random other person can walk away from the trade with a new Scizor. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Obtain Scizor in a 5- or 6-star Tera Raid Battle.
steps.content: Obtain Scizor in a 5- or 6-star Tera Raid Battle. Unfortunately, Scyther can only be evolved by trading with a friend—but there are other ways to catch Scizor. As you continue on your journey in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet, seek out any light pillars you find near your location, as these commence a Tera Raid Battle. Some 5- or 6-star battles feature Scizor, allowing you to catch him directly. [5] X Research source You might also find Scizor in 4-star raid battles. [6] X Research source This method requires a bit of patience and persistence. There are many Pokémon who can appear in a 5- or 6-star raid battle, so it may take some time before you encounter Scizor.

steps.title: Find Scyther near Casseroya Lake in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet.
steps.content: Find Scyther near Casseroya Lake in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet. The game’s official Pokédex notes that Scyther “lives in bamboo groves.” [7] X Research source With this in mind, Casseroya Lake is a popular hangout for Scyther, as well as North Province Area Two and South Province Areas Four and Six. [8] X Research source Scyther can also pop up in Wild Spawn Biomes, specifically in the forested and grassy areas.

steps.title: Obtain Black Augurite by fighting a Graveler.
steps.content: Obtain Black Augurite by fighting a Graveler. Wander around the Hisui region until you stumble across a Graveler—the Crimson Mirelands are a great place to start. Beat the Graveler (or catch it) to gain Black Augurite. [9] X Research source You can also dig up Black Augurite while riding an Ursaluna (especially if you’re near the cliffs), but battling Graveler is the most consistent way to get it.

steps.title: Give the Black Augurite to your Scyther.
steps.content: Give the Black Augurite to your Scyther. Unlike Scizor’s evolution path, Scyther doesn’t need to be traded to evolve into Kleavor. As soon as you give Black Augurite to your Pokémon, it will evolve directly into Kleavor, a Bug/Rock-type Pokémon. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Scyther evolves into Scizor in every Pokémon game when it’s traded with a Metal Coat.
steps.content: Scyther evolves into Scizor in every Pokémon game when it’s traded with a Metal Coat. Whether you’re playing a classic like Pokémon Gold or a 2000s game like Pokémon Diamond, Pearl, or Platinum, Scyther’s evolution process remains the same—it needs to be traded while holding a Metal Coat. [11] X Research source If you're on the hunt for a Metal Coat in an older game, there’s a 2-5% chance of certain Steel-type Pokémon holding this item when you catch them, like: Magnemite, Magneton, and Magnezone Bronzor and Bronzong Metang and Metagross Skarmony Beldum [12] X Research source

steps.title: Mega-evolve Scizor with Scizorite in several 3DS Pokémon games.
steps.content: Mega-evolve Scizor with Scizorite in several 3DS Pokémon games. Popular 3DS franchises like Pokémon X/Y, Pokémon Omega Red/Alpha Sapphire, Pokémon Sun/Moon, and Pokémon Ultra Sun/Moon let you mega evolve by giving him Scizorite, a special item. Here’s a closer look at how to get it: Pokémon X/Y: At one of the lower floors in the Frost Cavern (behind Abomasnow) [13] X Research source Pokémon OR/AS: In the Petalburg Woods, eastwards past the prickly tree [14] X Research source Pokémon Sun/Moon and US/UM: At the Battle Tree [15] X Research source

steps.title: Mega-evolve Scizor with Scizor Mega Energy in Pokémon Go.
steps.content: Mega-evolve Scizor with Scizor Mega Energy in Pokémon Go. Collect Scizor Mega Energy by participating in a lot of Scizor raids. Once you’ve mega-evolved Scizor at least once in your Pokémon Go game, set the Pokémon as your walking buddy to passively gain Scizor Mega Energy. [16] X Research source Keep in mind that only one Pokémon can be mega-evolved on your Pokémon team at one time.
